column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////The pizza tasted awesome after the wait for a table (and another 35 minute wait for the food). But I'm fairly sure it was only that good because of how absurdly hungry I was. I'm not convinced this is Chicago's Best Deep Dish Pizza. It was certainly filling
column2: and it's hard to screw up an inch-thick pile of cheese covered in sauce. The small size was just about right for two. The pizza had a pie-like
column5: sauce and a layer of sausage. Despite looking impressive
column6: it was surprisingly bland. Parmesean and pepper flakes were necessary to liven things up. The signed H.W. Bush Yale jersey they had on the wall next to us didn't help either.
